article.headline: Vermont 60, Albany, N.Y. 48
article.story: BURLINGTON, Vt. -- Matt Glass and Brendan Bald scored 13 points each to lead Vermont to a 60-48 victory over Albany (N.Y.) on Thursday night. The Catamounts (11-3, 2-0 America East Conference) trailed 23-22 at halftime after shooting just 27.6 percent from the floor (8 of 29) in the first half. Vermont, winners of four straight, started the second half on a 14-2 run -- led by five points from Bald -- to take a 36-25 lead with 14:42 remaining. The Catamounts led by at least seven the rest of the way. Two free throws from Simeon Marsalis extended Vermont's lead to 41-28 with 12:56 to go. The Catamounts shot 50 percent in the second half (10 of 20) and 14 of 16 from the free-throw line (87.5 percent). Logan Aronhalt led the Great Danes (8-9, 1-1) with 21 points. Mike Black added 13 and Tim Ambrose 10 on 4-of-17 shooting. The Catamounts held Albany to 38 percent shooting (19 for 50).

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
